channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Connecting the Dots: Floorplan Reconstruction Using Two-Level Queries
item.description: Instead, we formulate floorplan reconstruction as a single-stage structured prediction task: find a variable-size set of polygons, which in turn are variable-length sequences of ordered vertices.

item.title: Beyond Invariance: Test-Time Label-Shift Adaptation for Distributions with "Spurious" Correlations
item.description: Spurious correlations, or correlations that change across domains where a model can be deployed, present significant challenges to real-world applications of machine learning models.

item.title: Learning to design without prior data: Discovering generalizable design strategies using deep learning and tree search
item.description: The ultimate goal for a design agent is the ability to learn generalizable design behavior in a problem space without having seen it before.

item.title: Tuning-free Plug-and-Play Hyperspectral Image Deconvolution with Deep Priors
item.description: Deconvolution is a widely used strategy to mitigate the blurring and noisy degradation of hyperspectral images~(HSI) generated by the acquisition devices.

item.title: SuperFusion: Multilevel LiDAR-Camera Fusion for Long-Range HD Map Generation and Prediction
item.description: To this end, we propose a novel network named SuperFusion, exploiting the fusion of LiDAR and camera data at multiple levels.

item.title: Automatically generating question-answer pairs for assessing basic reading comprehension in Swedish
item.description: This paper presents an evaluation of the quality of automatically generated reading comprehension questions from Swedish text, using the Quinductor method.

item.title: Quantile Constrained Reinforcement Learning: A Reinforcement Learning Framework Constraining Outage Probability
item.description: This paper proposes a framework, named Quantile Constrained RL (QCRL), to constrain the quantile of the distribution of the cumulative sum cost that is a necessary and sufficient condition to satisfy the outage constraint.

item.title: An adaptive shortest-solution guided decimation approach to sparse high-dimensional linear regression
item.description: High-dimensional linear regression model is the most popular statistical model for high-dimensional data, but it is quite a challenging task to achieve a sparse set of regression coefficients.

item.title: Interactive Visual Feature Search
item.description: Many visualization techniques have been created to help explain the behavior of convolutional neural networks (CNNs), but they largely consist of static diagrams that convey limited information.

item.title: Refined Semantic Enhancement towards Frequency Diffusion for Video Captioning
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a novel Refined Semantic enhancement method towards Frequency Diffusion (RSFD), a captioning model that constantly perceives the linguistic representation of the infrequent tokens.

item.title: MicroAST: Towards Super-Fast Ultra-Resolution Arbitrary Style Transfer
item.description: The style encoder, coupled with a modulator, encodes the style image into learnable dual-modulation signals that modulate both intermediate features and convolutional filters of the decoder, thus injecting more sophisticated and flexible style signals to guide the stylizations.

item.title: Learning Dense Object Descriptors from Multiple Views for Low-shot Category Generalization
item.description: A hallmark of the deep learning era for computer vision is the successful use of large-scale labeled datasets to train feature representations for tasks ranging from object recognition and semantic segmentation to optical flow estimation and novel view synthesis of 3D scenes.

item.title: Generalized Category Discovery with Decoupled Prototypical Network
item.description: Furthermore, the coupled training approach prevents these models transferring category-specific knowledge explicitly from labeled data to unlabeled data, which can lose high-level semantic information and impair model performance.

item.title: Improved Representation of Asymmetrical Distances with Interval Quasimetric Embeddings
item.description: Asymmetrical distance structures (quasimetrics) are ubiquitous in our lives and are gaining more attention in machine learning applications.

item.title: Meta-analysis of individualized treatment rules via sign-coherency
item.description: Medical treatments tailored to a patient's baseline characteristics hold the potential of improving patient outcomes while reducing negative side effects.

item.title: Task-Aware Asynchronous Multi-Task Model with Class Incremental Contrastive Learning for Surgical Scene Understanding
item.description: Conclusion: The proposed multi-task model was able to adapt to domain shifts, incorporate novel instruments in the target domain, and perform tool-tissue interaction detection and report generation on par with single-task models.

item.title: A Critical Analysis of Classifier Selection in Learned Bloom Filters
item.description: Learned Bloom Filters, i. e., models induced from data via machine learning techniques and solving the approximate set membership problem, have recently been introduced with the aim of enhancing the performance of standard Bloom Filters, with special focus on space occupancy.

item.title: MixFairFace: Towards Ultimate Fairness via MixFair Adapter in Face Recognition
item.description: In this paper, we propose MixFairFace framework to improve the fairness in face recognition models.

item.title: DQ-DETR: Dual Query Detection Transformer for Phrase Extraction and Grounding
item.description: As phrase extraction can be regarded as a $1$D text segmentation problem, we formulate PEG as a dual detection problem and propose a novel DQ-DETR model, which introduces dual queries to probe different features from image and text for object prediction and phrase mask prediction.

item.title: Physics-informed neural networks with unknown measurement noise
item.description: Physics-informed neural networks (PINNs) constitute a flexible approach to both finding solutions and identifying parameters of partial differential equations.

item.title: Efficient Mirror Detection via Multi-level Heterogeneous Learning
item.description: We present HetNet (Multi-level \textbf{Het}erogeneous \textbf{Net}work), a highly efficient mirror detection network.

item.title: Heterogeneous Graph Learning for Multi-modal Medical Data Analysis
item.description: In this paper, we propose an effective graph-based framework called HetMed (Heterogeneous Graph Learning for Multi-modal Medical Data Analysis) for fusing the multi-modal medical data.

item.title: On the Effectiveness of Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning
item.description: How to choose the tunable parameters?

item.title: Discovering Dynamic Patterns from Spatiotemporal Data with Time-Varying Low-Rank Autoregression
item.description: In the temporal context, the complex time-varying system behaviors can be revealed by the temporal modes in the proposed model.

item.title: Mutual Exclusivity Training and Primitive Augmentation to Induce Compositionality
item.description: Recent datasets expose the lack of the systematic generalization ability in standard sequence-to-sequence models.

item.title: Dense Interspecies Face Embedding
item.description: There are three main obstacles for interspecies face understanding: (1) lack of animal data compared to human, (2) ambiguous connection between faces of various animals, and (3) extreme shape and style variance.

item.title: A Study of Representational Properties of Unsupervised Anomaly Detection in Brain MRI
item.description: Anomaly detection in MRI is of high clinical value in imaging and diagnosis.

item.title: Easy Begun is Half Done: Spatial-Temporal Graph Modeling with ST-Curriculum Dropout
item.description: Spatial-temporal (ST) graph modeling, such as traffic speed forecasting and taxi demand prediction, is an important task in deep learning area.

item.title: Recent Advances in RecBole: Extensions with more Practical Considerations
item.description: In order to show the recent update in RecBole, we write this technical report to introduce our latest improvements on RecBole.

item.title: Perceive, Ground, Reason, and Act: A Benchmark for General-purpose Visual Representation
item.description: Current computer vision models, unlike the human visual system, cannot yet achieve general-purpose visual understanding.

item.title: Fast-SNARF: A Fast Deformer for Articulated Neural Fields
item.description: A key challenge in making such methods applicable to articulated objects, such as the human body, is to model the deformation of 3D locations between the rest pose (a canonical space) and the deformed space.

item.title: Proactive Robot Assistance via Spatio-Temporal Object Modeling
item.description: Proactive robot assistance enables a robot to anticipate and provide for a user's needs without being explicitly asked.

item.title: On the Sample Complexity of Representation Learning in Multi-task Bandits with Global and Local structure
item.description: Arms consist of two components: one that is shared across tasks (that we call representation) and one that is task-specific (that we call predictor).

item.title: DeepAngle: Fast calculation of contact angles in tomography images using deep learning
item.description: DeepAngle is a machine learning-based method to determine the contact angles of different phases in the tomography images of porous materials.

item.title: Imperceptible Adversarial Attack via Invertible Neural Networks
item.description: Adding perturbations via utilizing auxiliary gradient information or discarding existing details of the benign images are two common approaches for generating adversarial examples.

item.title: Shielding in Resource-Constrained Goal POMDPs
item.description: We consider partially observable Markov decision processes (POMDPs) modeling an agent that needs a supply of a certain resource (e. g., electricity stored in batteries) to operate correctly.

item.title: MGFN: Magnitude-Contrastive Glance-and-Focus Network for Weakly-Supervised Video Anomaly Detection
item.description: Weakly supervised detection of anomalies in surveillance videos is a challenging task.

item.title: Learning Recommendations from User Actions in the Item-poor Insurance Domain
item.description: To address this, we present a recurrent neural network recommendation model that uses past user sessions as signals for learning recommendations.

item.title: Joint Multimodal Entity-Relation Extraction Based on Edge-enhanced Graph Alignment Network and Word-pair Relation Tagging
item.description: This paper is the first to propose jointly performing MNER and MRE as a joint multimodal entity-relation extraction task (JMERE).

item.title: G^3: Geolocation via Guidebook Grounding
item.description: We propose the task of Geolocation via Guidebook Grounding that uses a dataset of StreetView images from a diverse set of locations and an associated textual guidebook for GeoGuessr, a popular interactive geolocation game.

item.title: Weight Predictor Network with Feature Selection for Small Sample Tabular Biomedical Data
item.description: Tabular biomedical data is often high-dimensional but with a very small number of samples.

item.title: Class Adaptive Network Calibration
item.description: Comprehensive evaluation and multiple comparisons on a variety of benchmarks, including standard and long-tailed image classification, semantic segmentation, and text classification, demonstrate the superiority of the proposed method.

item.title: Toward Global Sensing Quality Maximization: A Configuration Optimization Scheme for Camera Networks
item.description: Then, we form a single quantity that measures the sensing quality of the targets by the camera network.

item.title: Optimal Sparse Regression Trees
item.description: Regression trees are one of the oldest forms of AI models, and their predictions can be made without a calculator, which makes them broadly useful, particularly for high-stakes applications.

item.title: Who is Gambling? Finding Cryptocurrency Gamblers Using Multi-modal Retrieval Methods
item.description: Meanwhile, decentralized applications have also attracted intense attention from the online gambling community, with more and more decentralized gambling platforms created through the help of smart contracts.

item.title: Unified Discrete Diffusion for Simultaneous Vision-Language Generation
item.description: The recently developed discrete diffusion models perform extraordinarily well in the text-to-image task, showing significant promise for handling the multi-modality signals.

item.title: Neural Font Rasterization
item.description: Recent advances in deep learning techniques and applications have revolutionized artistic creation and manipulation in many domains (text, images, music); however, fonts have not yet been integrated with deep learning architectures in a manner that supports their multi-scale nature.

item.title: Medical Image Segmentation Review: The success of U-Net
item.description: U-Net is the most widespread image segmentation architecture due to its flexibility, optimized modular design, and success in all medical image modalities.

item.title: BEAR: Physics-Principled Building Environment for Control and Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Recent advancements in reinforcement learning algorithms have opened doors for researchers to operate and optimize building energy management systems autonomously.

item.title: A Time Series is Worth 64 Words: Long-term Forecasting with Transformers
item.description: Our channel-independent patch time series Transformer (PatchTST) can improve the long-term forecasting accuracy significantly when compared with that of SOTA Transformer-based models.
